title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". The findings are also included in the Act. Congress finds that federal agencies have an obligation to comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999, which established a Government-wide goal for awarding contracts to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Progress in meeting this goal has been slow, and prime contractors doing business with the government must also contribute. The public has a right to know if the Government and prime contractors are meeting this goal. SEC. 3. Transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments are required to submit reports to the Administrator on the percentage of prime contracts awarded to these small businesses. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments must report on prime contracts awarded to these small businesses, including subcontractor utilization percentages and subcontract values. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments must report on prime contracts awarded to these small businesses, including subcontractor utilization percentages and values. Additionally, the Administrator will rank Executive departments based on prime contract values awarded. The Administrator will publish a report on a website with information on prime contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, including subcontractor utilization percentages and values. The Administrator will update a website quarterly with information on prime contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Additionally, an annual report on the progress of each Executive department towards meeting Government-wide contracting goals will be submitted to Congress. The report under subsection (g) must include whether the website has the latest data from Executive departments and a recommendation for a prime contractor excelling in contracting with service-disabled veteran-owned small businesses. This subsection does not affect other federal reporting requirements.
